category.name: anomalous
category.desc: These prime field curves have the same order as the field order, and are susceptible to attacks reducing ECDLP over a multiplicative group of the curve, to DLP over an additive group of the underlying field, which is easy (linear time).

category.name: brainpool
category.desc: ECC Brainpool Standard Curves and Curve Generation v. 1.0 19.10.2005

category.name: nist
category.desc: RECOMMENDED ELLIPTIC CURVES FOR FEDERAL GOVERNMENT USE July 1999

category.name: secg
category.desc: SEC 2: Recommended Elliptic Curve Domain Parameters version 2.0 January 27, 2010

category.name: nonprime
category.desc: Non-prime order curves, with points of very small order pregenerated.

category.name: wrong
category.desc: Wrong field curves. These should definitely give an error when used. Since the "prime" used for the field are not prime, and the field polynomials are also not irreducible. Simply put these parameters don't specify a valid elliptic curve.
